With normal use (not rough) for sensitive gums/teeth, this brush has most of bristles going bad within 15 days of use (twice a day). Not recommending for two reasons: [1] cost is too high [2] plastic use-n-throw within 2 weeks is bad for environment.

If you can get over them smelling like a moldy Barbie swimming pool set, then go for it. I used them once and never again. Too bad, cool pastel colours and brushing was fine.
The bristles of this super soft toothbrush were not as soft as I was expecting. The bristles then harden after use.
Package came in damaged, taped up, cracked plastic and water damage on the back. There is a smell to the back of the packaging, will be returning.
The product arrived open and taped together. The product is not for sale in North America and appeared to have been used.

The packaging was different than what is listed here. There or words in the Chinese language. The bristles are nice and soft but the handle is where the smell is coming from. So every time I brush I smelled that toxic smell. Amazon wants me to physically return it so that they can resell it so beware. You might just get my old ones

These are totally mislabeled as "soft." They are not. I've bought these in the past, and was happy with the softness, which helped me with my sensitive teeth and gums... But now they've changed. They aren't nearly as soft as they used to be. They hurt my gums... So my search for properly "soft" brushes continues...
I wanted a gentle soft toothbrush for my sensitive teeth and gums. This is not soft. Medium at best. Fine otherwise, but I still have to buy a soft toothbrush,  so money wasted for me.
As toothbrushes go these really are gentle and do the job, However, they are NOT battery operated. So don't expect that when you make your purchase.
Not ultra soft, as advertised. More like your standard soft toothbrush.
Average
I don't know who decided to call those sensitive tooth or soft brushes. They are the opposite.
I would not buy these toothbrushes. They are not meant for US market. Poor quality… not durable…

They’re cheap and I see why. The side bristles fray so easily and then they’ll make small cuts and abrasions on the sides of your mouth despite the bristles supposedly being soft. The whole point of having soft bristles is for heavy handed people but these clearly aren’t soft at all. I’m just gonna go back to the old soft bristle toothbrush brand i used before and toss these out, they’re absolute garbage.

The actual product package was cut open along the bottom and a big hole in the outer plastic.Might as well taken the toothbrushes out of the packing and threw them in a box to ship.Fortunately, it doesn't look like the actual toothbrushes were damaged.
The hardness of the toothbrush is definitely not ultra soft. It is more of a normal/medium brush. The brush causes gum pain and bleeding
These felt like typical soft toothbrushes, and didn't seem extra soft at all.  Ok bargain, but if you are looking for those super soft bristles, that are like velvet, these aren't it.
These are not soft toothbrushes, medium at best. The heads are small slightly bigger than a children's toothbrush. The packaging clearly stated not for sale in the USA. I guess, except for Amazon
Not extra soft......

Extremely disappointed in these toothbrushes.  I didn't look at the country of origin closely and the tooth brushes themselves were very stiff and not for sensitivity teeth/gums.  Looking at the markings these should have been ultra soft bristles, instead they are probably the equivalent of medium.  Very stiff.
These were very hard and made my gums bleed.
